acts.act: Protection of Children from Sexual Offence Act, 2012

judgment.error: Order not uploaded by concerned court

business_details.Business: The prosecution has brought the charges u/s. 363 of the Indian Penal Code and u/s. 4 of the POCSO Act. After considering the materials available in the case record, found that there are no materials to presume that this accused has committed an offence u/s.4 of the POCSO Act and therefore, he is discharged from the charge u/s. 4 of POCSO Act and this case may be registered as Sessions Case.
